intro: Calonemorchis magniclavata, commonly known as the giant club-moss, is a unique plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense clusters of small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called strobili, which are typically found at the tips of its branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forests. Due to its ancient lineage, it provides valuable insights into the evolution of early land plants.
